docs.snippet: The search for Nirav Modi captivates a country increasingly frustrated by corruption cases involving state banks that could cost taxpayers dearly.

headline.print_headline: Jeweler to the Stars  Flees as India Seethes
headline.main: Jeweler to the Stars Flees as India Seethes Over Bank Fraud

docs.snippet: The chasm between India’s digital governance aspirations and its ability to protect that data collected from hundreds of millions of citizens is growing increasingly wider.

headline.print_headline: India loves  data but fails  to protect it
headline.main: India Loves Data but Fails to Protect It

docs.snippet: Ola hopes to become a rare consumer technology firm in India that breaks away from home and grows in a well-to-do market where it can charge more.

headline.main: Uber’s New Rival in Australia: An Indian Upstart

docs.snippet: Air India became the first commercial airline permitted to fly over Saudi Arabia en route to and from Israel. Claiming discrimination, El Al is suing.

headline.main: El Al Sues Israel After Air India Flies Through Saudi Airspace

docs.snippet: Vindu Goel, our technology reporter in Mumbai, explains how cheap mobile data is changing the country and why WhatsApp is indispensable.

headline.print_headline: India, Where Everything but Clean Air Is Delivered
headline.main: In India, Everything Can Be Delivered (Except Clean Air)

docs.snippet: With tense meetings ahead with Beijing, Indian officials have been ordered to stay away from the Dalai Lama’s rally thanking India for hosting his exile.

headline.print_headline: India Says No Thanks to a Tibetan Tribute
headline.main: India Spurns the Dalai Lama’s Celebration, Worried About China

docs.snippet: The order was rescinded after an outcry among free-press advocates who said it could be used to blacklist journalists and silence criticism.

headline.print_headline: Crackdown On Reporters Deteriorates In India
headline.main: India’s ‘Fake News’ Crackdown Crumbles Over Journalists’ Outrage

docs.snippet: A publisher came under fire for featuring the dictator as one of 11 world figures said to have “devoted their lives for the betterment of their country and people.”

headline.print_headline: ‘Great Leader’ in Book for India Youth: Hitler
headline.main: Indian Children’s Book Lists Hitler as Leader ‘Who Will Inspire You’

docs.snippet: More aggressive enforcement has led to a large drop in illegal marriages, a new report finds. But in some areas, it is still a struggle to protect children.

headline.main: Uphill Battle Against Child Marriage Is Being Won in India, for Now

docs.snippet: Sri Lanka blocked access to the social network to help stem mob violence directed at its Muslim minority. Facebook said it was cooperating with the government.

headline.print_headline: Sri Lanka Blocks Facebook in Effort to Stem Violence
headline.main: In Sri Lanka, Facebook Contends With Shutdown After Mob Violence
